result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall Brent Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Randall Brent Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Randall Brent Johnson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample within 30 days.
Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.
2 days credit if probation is revoked.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall Brent Johnson

records.addlTxt: Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

01:57 PM Defendant Randall Brent Johnson in court.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joel Larimore appeared in court. 22CF23 and 20CF85 heard at this time. ADA Walker: resolution reached on both cases. Moves to rescind Motion to Revoke and dismiss count on 20CF85; Def provided proof of compliance. Guilty to Ct#2 in 22CF23 2 years probation; court costs ($543), DNA. Dismiss Ct#1 22CF23, Atty Larimore and Def agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Defendant pleas guilty to Ct#2 in 22CF23. Counsel stipulate to factual basis.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEFENDANT FREELY, VOLUNTARILY AND KNOWINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds Defendant guilty to Ct#2 in 22CF23, dismisses Ct#1. Court approves the State's motion to rescind/withdraw the motion to revoke in 20CF85 and dismisses Ct#1. ADA Walker and Atty Larimore address sentencing. Defendant addresses the court.  Court orders S/W 2 years probation; court costs ($543) DNA sample, comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. 2 days credit if probation is revoke.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 2:12
Status conference on April 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Information filed with the Court.  DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 1:04 pm.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif

12:58 PM Defendant Randall Brent Johnson appears in Court, Atty Joel Kenneth Larimore. ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court takes judicial notice of 20CF85. Sgt. Zachary Thurber . S/T. ADA Walker questions Sgt Thurber. Record reflects identification of DE. Atty Larimore cross. ADA Walker is requesting the Court find probable cause and bind DE over for trial, Atty Larimore argues.  The Court finds probable cause and binds DE over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on April 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:27 AM Defendant Randall Brent Johnson in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  20CF85 (MH) and 22CF23 (STC) ADA Walker moves to schedule 22CF23 for PH and reset the motion hearing on 20CF85. Atty Larimore agrees. Court scheduled 22CF23 for a PH and 20CF85 for MH. 11:30  Motion hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on March 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
NO ABUSIVE OR VIOLENT CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH J.A.W. FOLLOWING THE 72 HR NC ORDER.
Defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.

3:17 PM Defendant Randall Brent Johnson appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Scott Selmer , ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court confirms address. DE does not qualify for PD, clerk send a PFAC down.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. ADA Walker is requesting a $5,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of NAC J.A.W. following the expiration of the 72 hr NC and AS, no objection. Court orders bond as requested. Court reviews DE's rights. DE plans on retaining counsel. Waive time limits. Court adjourned at 3:24 pm.  Status conference scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.
